name: Exam project
subtitle: 2 semester
body: This was our second-semester exam project, created for the Steno Museum’s upcoming exhibition “The Overlooked Body.” We were given the choice of nine different themes, and my group and I chose to focus on mental illness, specifically anxiety. Our intention was to convey what it can feel like to experience anxiety; however, since it is often a deeply personal and individual experience, we decided to place greater emphasis on highlighting that, as a relative or companion, the most important thing you can do when someone is having a panic attack is to listen to their needs.

name: Exam project - Figma prototype
subtitle: Go to prototype
body: We prototyped everything for the exam project in Figma. I created the whole prototype, so we could test the user flow and interactions.

name: Interactive storytelling
subtitle: A project i had in the 2 semester
body: This was a project we developed for the Steno Museum, where we were tasked with selecting an exhibition and designing an interactive storytelling experience for a specific age group. My group chose the exhibition on the solar system and targeted children aged 5–10. Our goal was to communicate the complex facts about the solar system in a fun and engaging way that would not only capture the children’s interest but also ensure they could remember the key information afterwards.

name: Northern Decoration
subtitle: Website
